alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 10:27PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND EAST CENTRAL GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM MDT... At 1027 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montoya, or 20 miles southwest of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Quay, Ragland, and Montoya. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 311 and 317. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
